title: CTRL0000050105 - Transcribed Interview of Jewll Powdrell, (February 23, 2022)

data.text: SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE
JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES,
WASHINGTON, D.C.
DEPOSITION OF:
JEWLL POWDRELL (NO-SHOW)
Wednesday, February 23, 2022
Washington, D.C.
The deposition in the above matter was held in Room 1540A, Longworth House
Office Building, commencing at 10:00 a.m.
Appearances:
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
INVESTIGATIVE COUNSEL
CHIEF ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER
OF COUNSEL TO THE VICE CHAIR
All right.
We are on the record.
Today is February 23rd, 2022.
The time is 10 o'clock a.m. eastern.
We are convened in the Longworth House Office
Building for the deposition of Mr. Jewll Powdrell to be conducted by the House Select
Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol.
My name is
counsel for this proceeding.
senior investigative counsel and of counsel to the vice chair; as well as
who is professional staff for the select committee.
I am the designated select committee investigative
I am accompanied today b y - who serves as
For the record, it is 10:01 a.m., and Mr. Powdrell is not present.
The person
transcribing this proceeding is the House Stenographer and notary public authorized to
administer oaths.
On January 28th, 2022, Chairman Benny Thompson issued a subpoena to Mr.
Powdrell, both to produce documents by February 11th, 2022, and to testify at a
deposition on February 23rd, 2022, at 10 o'clock a.m.
select committee's investigation into the facts, circumstances, and causes of the
January 6th attack, and issues relating to the peaceful transfer of power in order to
identify and evaluate lessons learned and to recommend to the House and its relevant
committees corrective laws, policies, procedures, rules, or regulations.
On February 11th, 2022, Mr. Powdrell contacted
This subpoena pertains to the
, senior
investigative counsel for the select committee, and left a voicemail message.
In the
message, Mr. Powdrell indicated that he did not possess any documents relating to either
the electoral college vote on December 14th, 2020, or the attack on the United States
Capitol on January 6th, 2021.
before the select committee on the requested date.
Mr. Powdrell further indicated that he would not appear
spoke with Mr. Powdrell by phone on February 15th, 2022.
During
the call, Mr. Powdrell reiterated his earlier claims and stated that he had no information
to provide to the select committee.
as an alternate elector in the State of New Mexico for the 2020 Presidential election and
that he signed and submitted certificates purporting to cast electoral college votes for
Donald J. Trump for President and Michael Pence for Vice President.
When asked, Mr. Powdrell confirmed that he acted
During the call, Mr. Powdrell indicated that he cannot travel due to family
caregiving responsibilities, nor does he have an attorney. -
that the select committee is willing to speak with him remotely via video teleconference
and at a time of his choosing.
and did not intend to appear today.
Mr. Powdrell indicated that he had given us his answers
Yesterday, on February 22nd, 2022
explained to him
called Mr. Powdrell, and Mr.

the January 6th attack on the U.S. Capitol.
10 a.m. eastern.
conference, if you so choose.
Mr. Powdrell, I'm reaching out again from the select committee to Investigate
The deposition tomorrow will occur at
As I mentioned on the phone, we are happy to proceed via video
Please contact me with any updates you may have.
As of right now, at 10:04 a.m., Mr. Powdrell has not responded to either o f - a t t e m p t s to contact him.
During the call that took place on February 15th, 2 0 2 2 , - a l s o explained
to Mr. Powdrell that he has a legal requirement to comply with the select committee's
subpoena, and, further, that failing to do so could subject him to legal consequences.
urged him to reconsider his choice not to participate.
Mr. Powdrell
indicated that he understood and reiterated that he does not intend to comply with his
subpoena.
I will mark as exhibit 1 and enter into the record the select committee subpoena
to Mr. Powdrell, which was accompanied by a letter from the chairman, document
schedule with accompanying production instructions, and a copy of the deposition rules.
[Powdrell Exhibit No. 1
Was marked for identification.]
With that, I will note for the record that it is 10:05 a.m., and Mr.
Powdrell still has not appeared or communicated to the select committee that he will
appear today as required by the subpoena.
Accordingly, the record is now closed as of
[Whereupon, at 10:06 a.m., the deposition was concluded.]
